item.title: Plushies and Nanoblocks of Snow Miku and Rabbit Yukine Now Available At Snow Miku Sky Town
item.dc:creator: mikufan.com
item.description:
The Snow Miku Sky Town gift shop at New Chitose airport will soon be celebrating its 1 year anniversary on December 20th, and it has released new plushies and nanoblock sets of Snow Miku and Rabbit Yukine for the special occassion.

They became available starting December 5th, with no planned end date (perhaps as long

The post Plushies and Nanoblocks of Snow Miku and Rabbit Yukine Now Available At Snow Miku Sky Town appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The Snow Miku Sky Town gift shop at New Chitose airport will soon be celebrating its 1 year anniversary on December 20th, and it has released new plushies and nanoblock sets of Snow Miku and Rabbit Yukine for the special occassion.

They became available starting December 5th, with no planned end date (perhaps as long as supply lasts?). The Snow Miku plushie, based on the appearance of Snow Miku 2011 is 19cm tall, and is priced at 3200 Yen (tax excluded). Rabbit Yukine is 15cm tall, and priced at 1200 Yen (tax excluded).

The post Plushies and Nanoblocks of Snow Miku and Rabbit Yukine Now Available At Snow Miku Sky Town appeared first on VNN.

item.title: “Gohatto Disco” Featured in the 24th YOSAKOI Soran Festival
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
The popular song Gohatto Disco was released earlier this year on the official Miku Channel with talk of it being part of the YOSAKOI Soran Festival in Sapporo, Crypton's home town. Now Miku Channel has given us a video of the young dancers who took to the streets in the festival, dancing in the Yosakoi

The post “Gohatto Disco” Featured in the 24th YOSAKOI Soran Festival appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The popular song Gohatto Disco was released earlier this year on the official Miku Channel with talk of it being part of the YOSAKOI Soran Festival in Sapporo, Crypton’s home town. Now Miku Channel has given us a video of the young dancers who took to the streets in the festival, dancing in the Yosakoi style while donning special t-shirts featuring the special Snow Miku design in the song’s promotional video, and some of the girls are even sporting twin tails.

If you’re in need of something adorable, look no further.

The post “Gohatto Disco” Featured in the 24th YOSAKOI Soran Festival appeared first on VNN.
